content.description: <math alttext="A 4 by 3 labeled Matrix H. Rows are labeled First Year, Sophomore, Junior, and Senior. Columns are labeled A, B, and C. The values in the matrix are as follows. First Year, A, 0.5. First Year, B, 2. First Year C, 1. Sophomore, A, 1. Sophomore, B, 3. Sophomore, C, 1. Junior, A, 2. Junior, B, 1. Junior, C, 2. Senior, A, 1. Senior, B, 0.5. Senior C, 2."><mtable columnalign="right center"><mtr><mtd> </mtd><mtd><mtable><mtr><mtd><mpadded lspace="-3px"><mtext>A</mtext></mpadded></mtd><mtd><mpadded lspace="+6px"><mtext>B</mtext></mpadded></mtd><mtd><mpadded lspace="+9px"><mtext>C</mtext></mpadded></mtd></mtr></mtable></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mtable><mtr><mtd><mtext>First Year</mtext></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mtext>Sophomore</mtext></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mtext>Junior</mtext></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mtext>Senior</mtext></mtd></mtr></mtable></mtd><mtd><mfenced close="]" open="["><mtable><mtr><mtd><mn>0.5</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>2</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>3</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>2</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>2</mn></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><mn>1</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>0.5</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>2</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mfenced></mtd></mtr></mtable></math>
content.question: Matrix <math alttext="H"><mi>H</mi></math> Of the <math alttext="20"><mn>20</mn></math> students in a school club, <math alttext="4"><mn>4</mn></math> students are first year, <math alttext="3"><mn>3</mn></math> are sophomores, <math alttext="8"><mn>8</mn></math> are juniors, and <math alttext="5"><mn>5</mn></math> are seniors. This class-level distribution can be represented by the matrix <math alttext="Matrix L equals, a matrix with 1 row and 4 columns. Column 1 is 4. Column 2 is 3. Column 3 is 8. Column 4 is 5."><mi>L</mi><mo>=</mo><mfenced close="]" open="["><mtable><mtr><mtd><mn>4</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>3</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>8</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>5</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mfenced></math>. During the school year, each student in the club is required to work on projects for different amounts of time, depending on each studentâ€™s class level. The given matrix <math alttext="H"><mi>H</mi></math> represents the hours required by class level for three projects A, B, and C. Which of the following matrices represents the total number of hours spent by all <math alttext="20"><mn>20</mn></math> students combined on each of the three projects?

choices.label: <math alttext="A 1 by 3 matrix. Column 1 is 4.5. Column 2 is 6.5. Column 3 is 6."><mfenced close="]" open="["><mtable><mtr><mtd><mn>4.5</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>6.5</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>6</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mfenced></math>

<math alttext="A 1 by 3 matrix. Column 1 is 14. Column 2 is 15. Column 3 is 40."><mfenced close="]" open="["><mtable><mtr><mtd><mn>14</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>15</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>40</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mfenced></math>

<math alttext="A 1 by 3 matrix. Column 1 is 18. Column 2 is 19.5. Column 3 is 48."><mfenced close="]" open="["><mtable><mtr><mtd><mn>18</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>19.5</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>48</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mfenced></math>

<math alttext="A 1 by 3 matrix. Column 1 is 26. Column 2 is 27.5. Column 3 is 33."><mfenced close="]" open="["><mtable><mtr><mtd><mn>26</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>27.5</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>33</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mfenced></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="A 1 by 3 matrix. Column 1 is 26. Column 2 is 27.5. Column 3 is 33."><mfenced close="]" open="["><mtable><mtr><mtd><mn>26</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>27.5</mn></mtd><mtd><mn>33</mn></mtd></mtr></mtable></mfenced></math>
